channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Verge
item.description: Another talk I gave presenting dnasim.

item.title: Dnaism
item.description: In this talk I present dnasim.

item.title: Asap
item.description: In this talk I go over the ASAP paper which presents a smoothing technique for time series data.

item.title: About
item.description: When I am not building something on a computer, I like biking, running, swimming and outdoor sports in general. But I guess I should tell you about my CS background. Here we go… My first exposure to computers was in high school when my parents sent me to a programming boot camp when I was in high school. Basic was the introductory programming language they used in the course.

item.title: Fourier
item.description: My efforts to understand how the Fourier transform works.

item.title: Next Gen Deck
item.description: A Dashboard to facilitate quality control for genomic data.

item.title: Temp Sensor
item.description: Temperature and humidity sensor with Librato as a backend.

item.title: OpenNest
item.description: A modest nest-like device using Arduino hardware.

item.title: Euler
item.description: Solutions in Go and Python for some of the Euler challenges.

item.title: Egjs
item.description: Real time allele screening method for genomic data.

item.title: Bio Brew
item.description: A tiny package manager for crucial Unix and Bioinformatics tools.

item.title: Vim Markdown
item.description: A vim plugin to render, view and sync up markdown from vim.

item.title: Dnaism
item.description: Bringing the power of horizon charts to the genomic domain.

Curriculum Vitae For a more detailed version of this document and the full list of Employment history, please click here. Also, if you want to read the prose version of my cv, check out my about page. Education 1995-2003 Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, La Salle School of Engineering, Ramon Llull University, Barcelona, Spain. Final Project: Building a mp3 player from scratch.
